intro: Synaedrys rhombocarpa, commonly known as the diamond-fruit, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a woody capsule that splits open to release seeds, and it is adapted to grow in dry, sandy soils. The plant has traditional medicinal uses and is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes.
